params.taskDescription:
If you draw 1 tile at random, compute
  1. P ( tile shows A ) P\left({\text{tile shows A}}\right)
  2. P ( tile shows A | tile shows a vowel ) P\left(\text{tile shows A}\,|\,\text{tile shows a vowel}\right)

params.taskDescription:
If you draw 1 tile at random, compute:
  1. P ( tile shows a vowel ) P({\text{tile shows a vowel}})
  2. P ( tile shows a vowel | tile shows a letter that comes after M alphabetically ) P\left({\text{tile shows a vowel}}\,|\,{\text{tile shows a letter that comes after M alphabetically}}\right)

params.notEnoughChars: You must enter at least @chars characters!
params.ariaNavigatedToSolution: Navigated to newly included sample solution after textarea.
params.ariaShowSolution: Show the solution. You will be provided with a sample solution.
params.ariaRetry: Retry the task. You can improve your previous answer if the author allowed that.
params.taskDescription:
If you draw 2 tiles with replacement, compute <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>P</mi>
  <mo stretchy="false">(</mo>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mtext>both are vowels</mtext>
  </mrow>
  <mo stretchy="false">)</mo>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">P({\text{both are vowels}})</annotation></semantics></math>.

questionSetStimulus: In the following exercises, you are about to draw Scrabble tiles from a bag; the bag contains the letters A, A, C, E, E, E, L, L, N, O, R, S, S, S, T, X.
